track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
It's all about speed, accuracy and efficiency. Inside the contest are 4 challenges. You have exactly 180 minutes to solve them. Every second counts. 101 is a new monthly contest and this is the first from the series.

We are very excited to launch this event because we just hit the 100,000 user mark!

HackerRank invites you to join the contest to compete against hackers from across the globe.
primary_contest.name: 101 Hack

model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function commonChild($s1, $s2){
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%s",$s1);
fscanf($handle, "%s",$s2);
$result = commonChild($s1, $s2);
echo $result . "\n";

?>

model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    s1 <- getLine
    s2 <- getLine

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Given two strings a and b of equal length, what's the longest string (s) that can be constructed such that s is a child to both a and b?
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [S1]} = io:fread("", "~s"),
    { ok, [S2]} = io:fread("", "~s"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
